node.title: Man convicted of careless driving after fatal crash disqualified from driving for 12 months
node.description: A young man who caused the death of an RSE worker while driving a van on the Napier-Taup≈ç highway has been convicted and disqualified from driving for 12 months.
node.content:
["A young man who caused the death of an RSE worker while driving a van on the Napier-Taup\u014d highway has been convicted and disqualified from driving for 12 months.", "", "
\nPhoto: RNZ / Rebekah Parsons-King\n
", "Nicholas Timothy Yorke, 20, appeared in the Napier District Court today.", "An application for a discharge without conviction was declined.", "Nearly a year and a half ago on 19 October 2020, Recognised Seasonal Employer (RSE) workers from Thornhill, a Hawke's Bay-based viticultural and horticultural employment company, were travelling in a three van convoy from Hastings to Taup\u014d for a holiday.", "Yorke was driving the third van and Tino Tagiilima, a 37-year-old RSE worker from Samoa, was in the passenger seat. Nine others were in the van.", "They were stopping at the Tarawera Cafe, about an hour from Napier.", "The two vans ahead of him had turned right the cafe. Yorke stopped on the side of the road, about to turn right into the cafe.", "As he started turning, a truck carrying wine tankers came up from behind and collided with Yorke's van.", "Tagiilima, a father of five, died in the crash. Two were critically injured and eight others has serious or moderate injuries.", "Judge Gordon Matenga called the offending a \"serious error of judgement\".", "In November, Yorke pleaded guilty to charges of careless use of a motor vehicle causing death and injury.", "This is the most recent fatal crash on the notorious stretch of highway. Nine people died on the highway between 2019 and 2020.", "Police and Waka Kotahi launched a campaign after the spate of crashes, and there have been no fatal crashes since that campaign began.", "A new 80-km speed limit has been in place on the road for nearly a month. This has caused much controversy in the local community."]
